resources.string: password should be at least 6 digit length
"Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."
Perform visual inspection of all USV deck assemblies. Pay special attention to the transom.
Check the integrity of the grounding cable.
Check the lifting eyes for bumps and corrosion especially the connections to the deck.
Verify that the railing cables are not cracked, rust and intact. Apply Silicon grease or replace cable if necessary.
Check the integrity of the USV hull to detect cracks and bumps.
Verify that both engines and WCS seawater inlets are intact and clean.
Perform visual inspection to all zincs at the transom. Replace if the zinc is less than 50% from its original size.
Verify that the rubber seals of all hatches are not cracked and intact. Apply Silicon grease and repair if necessary.
Clean the Hatches safety pistons with WD40.Tighten all pistons screws and verify that all the safety pins are in place. Verify all safety rings of hatch node are in place. Clean them if necessary.
Verify all drainage pipes are secured by two bands, add if necessary. Clean all pipe lines.
Verify double metal band tighten on all the flexible hoses connections.
Clean the Boat Control Cabinet displays and panels using a soaked mop.
Visually inspect control levers for corrosion. Clean if necessary.

Clean C2 compartments: Remove all external equipment from the Boat Control Cabinet and the Crew Cabinet. Wash the salt of the Boat Control Cabinet and the Crew Cabinet using fresh water hose set to 2-3 atm. Wash all marine equipment, including life vests. Dry the compartments.
Wash the Engine compartment with fresh water and bilge soap with caution for electrical connections. Dry the Engine compartment completely.
Wash and dry the cargo pit covers.
Clean the outside of the hull using soap and a brush. Give special notice to the transom as it is catching the exhaust gases.
Clean the boat deck using soap and water.
Clean the electronic boxes in the cargo pit from salt using a moist mop, Verify that the Electronics Cabinet covers are secured to its place.
Compare the amount of fuel reported in the Maretron display to the amount recorded in the ship log. Write down the lifetime fuel consumption on the report.
Check the fuel hoses in the engine compartments for corrosion. If needed, apply Molykote 33 Light grease/LOCTITE Marine Grade Anti-Seize on the hoses connections.

Drain some fuel from the separator (a cork at the bottom of the transparent tank) and visually inspect the fuel using a clean bottle. CAUTION Presence of water or excessive contamination in the fuel disqualifies it from use.
